intro: Psychotria miradorensis, commonly known as the Mirador Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
